column4: I've got updates waiting for linux-image but they keep being 'held-back'... do I just have to wait for the updates to arrive?
No, sudo apt-get dist-upgrade instead of upgrade
that says unmet dependencies and tries to remove linux-image in order to resolve them
That means you've got something going on.  What unmet dependencies?
http://paste.debian.net/38151/
do you have jaunty-proposed enabled by any chance? Mind pastbinning your sources.list?
I do have jaunty-proposed...
http://pastebin.com/f7606ec06
The contents would be nice :)
ha! echo != cat...
http://pastebin.com/f6796aff
Right, you have jaunty-proposed enabled (you shouldn't!)  It is a staging area for packages, so it seems they've upgraded linux-generic there, and it doesn't have the other kernels yet.
hmmm, so I either remove the proposed or wait for the rest of the packages to arrive??
remove the propsed.  It's not meant for normal consumption
I'm removing it and downgrading packages
no need to downgrade, regular packages will catch up and you'll be fine.
good point
Assuming the packages are all stable now ;)
sigh, that was an error adding that repo... I've removed it, I'll check in a while to see if -updates has caught up
cheers
There's no reason to hand-edit passwd
